title: [BUG] Performance drop on 1.68.2-preview45
body:
**Description**

After making switch from 1.68.1, I noticed significant performance drop, especially when rendering labels - when rendering 15 labels at a time, it works just fine on 1.68.1, but is extremely choppy on preview45.

It's happening in latest version of Mapsui with SKGL renderer.

**Basic Information**

- Version with issue:  1.68.2-preview45
- Last known good version: 1.68.1
- IDE:  Visual Studio 
- Platform Target Frameworks:
  - Android: 9.0
- Target Devices:   
  - Xiaomi Redmi 5 Plus
  - Xiaomi MI A2

comments.author: hajmajeboss
comments.body: Maybe it's because there was no antialising in 1.68.1 and it's back in 1.68.2?

comments.author: mattleibow
comments.body:
Are you able to check v1.68.1.1?
Is this just a SkiaSharp update, or did you update Mapsui as well? 

Is it possible to attach a mini repro (or link to source) of this so I can have a closer look?

I had a look at the diff between v1.68.1.1 and v1.68.2 and there is not much actual changes. Mostly just obsoletes. But, There may be something extra that was included that might have caused this. The one thing that did change was to upgrade the NDK from r15 to r19... But with a repro case I can change versions and profile to see exactly where the delays are coming in.

comments.author: hajmajeboss
comments.body:
I will try to make you a sample probably next weekend, I'm quite stacked at the moment, mostly because I spent tons of time trying to optimize and stabilize the map, but it's all coming together now.

I think there is change in the way geometries are rendered - there is no antialiasing when I run 1.68.1.1, which might cause the sudden performance gain. 

I noticed immediately it's slower when I installed the preview45 version, but I thought it's because I started rendering rotated labels. Then I installed 1.68.1.something and it worked better on my older phone. It works pretty much the same on my new phone - not great, but usuable.

comments.author: mattleibow
comments.body:
I'll have a closer look at the changes, just in case I can spot something. This is a little interesting because the native library hasn't changed - it is still the m68 series - although there were changes to the compiler version.

But, I'll look some more and see what I can see. Send in the repro as soon as you can.
